Description: Body sherd of Attic pottery Gordion cup; interior glazed black; exterior: reserved handle zone; black lower body; part of ancient repair hole on upper edge of sherd on left; inscription in handle zone.
Curator's comments: The piece is also illustrated by Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., 61,D9.2, pl. 49f.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.7)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 270, no. 58)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 381-2, no. B 535)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 232, no. 14 (b))
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0410) (Phase 1)
Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 233, no. 15)
